intro: Parietaria debilis var. floridana, commonly known as Florida wall-rocket, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tiny, yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Botanically, it belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible parts.
